text_image_relationship.layout_style: Two columns of text flanking a rectangular historiated miniature in the upper right of the right column; wide margins on all sides filled with vine-scroll borders populated by birds and foliate motifs; lower margin contains two small combat vignettes; a large ornamental initial interrupts the second column mid-page; central vertical stem with grotesque figure divides the columns.

text_content.script_style: Gothic textura quadrata book hand with regular, angular letterforms, tight line spacing, extensive use of ligatures and abbreviations, executed by a professional scribe

color_scheme.color_usage: Burnished gold leaf highlights the castle crenellations, decorative borders, and rubricated text; ultramarine anchors the miniature background and knights’ surcoats; vermillion punctuates shields, decorative initials, and marginal flourishes; green appears in foliage and mantles; white lead is used for highlights on drapery folds and armor; pigments are well preserved with minimal oxidation of white lead and stable lake reds.

features: Two mounted knights facing each other center-stage
Fortress façade as balanced backdrop with five crenellated towers
Horizontal baseline of grassy ground unifying figures
Lower margin bilateral combat vignettes echo central duel
Central stem and border vines provide vertical symmetry

decorative_elements: Vine-scroll border with acanthus leaves and gold bezants
Grotesque human figure climbing the central divider
Ornamental initial 'C' with interlaced foliage and gilt dots
Lower margin battle vignettes with knights in combat

drawing_technique.line_style: Fine quill pen outlines in dark brown ink with fluid strokes and moderate variation in line weight
drawing_technique.shading_method: Flat application of color with minimal tonal shading, white lead highlights on drapery and armor edges
drawing_technique.perspective_handling: Hierarchical scaling absent; overlapping figures and truncated foreshortening in the fortress suggest depth without linear perspective

content_theme.scene_description: A single centralized battle scene occupies the upper right column. Two mounted knights, each armored and bearing heraldic surcoats, clash before a fortified castle. The left knight wears a blue surcoat semé of gold, wields a longsword, and his pedestal horse is caparisoned in matching hues. The right knight, in a pink surcoat with green mantle, raises a mace above his helm, and his horse is draped in green. Behind them, a high curtain wall with alternating blue and gold checkerwork and five crenellated towers forms a schematic architectural backdrop. The grassy foreground is painted green with scattered white flowers. Below the miniature, two lines of red rubric introduce the scene. The lower margin features two smaller duels: at left, three infantrymen in cotta wield spears; at right, two knights in close combat. A large ornamental initial 'C' in the right column displays interlaced foliage and gilt dots, while the margins are enlivened by a vine-scroll inhabited by birds and a grotesque human climbing the central stem.

secular: Mounted knight in ultramarine surcoat semé of gold, sallet helm, wielding longsword
Mounted knight in pink surcoat with green mantle, raising mace
Three infantrymen in lower left margin with spears and simple tunics
Two knights in lower right margin in steel helms and surcoats, engaged in combat

architectural: Fortified castle wall with checkerboard pattern
Cusped arch window tracery in battlements
natural: White floral motifs on grassy ground

technical_features.material: Premium calf vellum with uniform cream tone, slight translucence; ruled with plummet in regular two-column format; smooth, chalk-prepared surface
technical_features.preservation_condition: Good overall; pigments remain vivid; minor flaking of vermillion in margin; slight darkening of recessed gold leaf; faint smudging in lower margin
notable_physical_characteristics: Raised gesso under gold leaf in borders and miniature
Underdrawing visible under UV in figure outlines
Regular plummet ruling lines between columns
Punchwork decoration in gold ground of miniature

analysis.scholarly_interpretation: This mid-14th-century manuscript leaf, likely produced in a northern French workshop, exemplifies the illustrated chanson de geste tradition. The two-column Gothic textura quadrata text in Old French, rubricated in red, indicates a finely executed secular epic intended for aristocratic consumption and oral performance. The historiated miniature of a jousting scene before a checkerboard castle, framed by burnished gold and vibrant ultramarine, reflects the era’s fascination with chivalry and feudal architecture. The balanced, symmetrical composition and schematic perspective situate the combat within a clearly defined narrative space, while the marginal vignettes and grotesque climbing figure enliven the borders in the International Gothic style. Technical hallmarks—raised gesso, punchwork in gold grounds, and underdrawing visible under UV—demonstrate sophisticated workshop practices, including collaborative production by specialist illuminators. Iconographically, the confrontation before fortified walls underscores themes of political power and martial valor, linking the poem’s recounting of Danish exploits to contemporary concerns of lordship and territorial defense. Comparisons with the manuscripts of the Guillaume d’Orange cycle and the British Library’s Cotton MS Tiberius C VIII reveal shared border motifs and border acanthus patterns, suggesting a network of exchange among Parisian and Flemish ateliers. The leaf thus represents both a continuation of traditional epic illumination and an innovative integration of fine detail, coloristic richness, and decorative exuberance characteristic of the mid-14th century.
